page.title: 14Life on a Dairy Farm 2
page.content:
During the summer the cows go out in the fields. The work is quite easy then although it is busy when we are making{silage.
In the summer we cut the grass, which is chopped and brought into the silage pit. The grass is rolled and then covered. It sort of ferments during the summer and is ready for feeding to the cows the following winter.
In the winter the cows are confined to the yard area. They are fed with silage and milled food concentrate twice a day. Every day the yard has to be scraped. As well as this Dad still has to do the milking. It is very hard work. Sometimes I help by washing down the parlour after milking.
